sections.TOP:
Lord of Casterly Rock05238p6n8cnyh82fjjapzxiht9jcpmh2mb2w1672292014-12-07T20:09:48ZThe Snow Prince24099677[[File:CasterlyRockCompleteGuide.png|thumb|[[Casterly Rock]], the seat of the Lord of Casterly Rock.]]

The '''Lord of Casterly Rock''' is the ruler of the stronghold [[Casterly Rock]], the capital of [[The Westerlands|the Westerlands]]. The holder is the ruler of the entire region of [[The Westerlands|the Westerlands]].

The Westerlands were originally a sovereign nation known as the ''[[Kingdom of the Rock]]'', until [[Aegon the Conqueror]] arrived in [[Westeros]] and united the [[Seven Kingdoms]]. [[House Lannister]], the richest family in the Seven Kingdoms, have ruled as the Lords of Casterly Rock for hundreds of years.

[[Tywin Lannister]] is Lord of Casterly Rock at the beginning of the series. He inherited the title from his father [[Tytos Lannister]]. Typically, the Lord of Casterly Rock also holds the title of [[Warden of the West]].
==â€‹History==

===[[Season 3]]===
Despite [[Tyrion Lannister]] being the heir to Casterly Rock since his elder brother [[Jaime Lannister|Jaime]] is a knight of the [[Kingsguard]], Lord Tywin has made it clear that he has no intention of allowing Tyrion to be the Lord of Casterly Rock following his death. It is therefore not clear who the heir to Casterly Rock currently is.<ref>"[[Valar Dohaeris]]"</ref>

===[[Season 4]]===
With the [[Assassination at the Tower of the Hand|murder]] of [[Tywin Lannister]], Queen [[Cersei Lannister]] stands as the new Lady of [[Casterly Rock]] as Tywin's closest lawful heir, since [[Tyrion Lannister]] has been declared guilty of [[regicide]] and fled across the [[Narrow Sea]]. Although Jaime made a deal with Tywin to leave the Kingsguard and become his heir again, Tyrion's guilty verdict rendered that deal null, even if Tywin had lived.
